title: supplied instant is later than self

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.52.1 (9bc8c42bb 2021-05-09) binary: rustc commit-hash: 9bc8c42bb2f19e745a63f3445f1ac248fb015e53 commit-date: 2021-05-09 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.52.1 LLVM version: 12.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'supplied instant is later than self', library/std/src/time.rs:281:48 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.52.1 (9bc8c42bb 2021-05-09) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C opt-level=3 -C embed-bitcode=no --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden ```
Backtrace

``` 0: rust_begin_unwind at /rustc/9bc8c42bb2f19e745a63f3445f1ac248fb015e53/library/std/src/panicking.rs:493:5 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt at /rustc/9bc8c42bb2f19e745a63f3445f1ac248fb015e53/library/core/src/panicking.rs:92:14 2: core::option::expect_failed at /rustc/9bc8c42bb2f19e745a63f3445f1ac248fb015e53/library/core/src/option.rs:1321:5 3: core::option::Option::expect at /rustc/9bc8c42bb2f19e745a63f3445f1ac248fb015e53/library/core/src/option.rs:349:21 4: std::time::Instant::duration_since at /rustc/9bc8c42bb2f19e745a63f3445f1ac248fb015e53/library/std/src/time.rs:281:9 5: ::sub at /rustc/9bc8c42bb2f19e745a63f3445f1ac248fb015e53/library/std/src/time.rs:406:9 6: std::time::Instant::elapsed at /rustc/9bc8c42bb2f19e745a63f3445f1ac248fb015e53/library/std/src/time.rs:345:9 7: rustc_codegen_llvm::base::compile_codegen_unit 8: ::codegen_crate 9: rustc_interface::passes::QueryContext::enter 10: rustc_interface::queries::Queries::ongoing_codegen 11: rustc_interface::queries::::enter 12: rustc_span::with_source_map 13: rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run 14: scoped_tls::ScopedKey::set ```

This might be an LLVM bug, as it never occurs on Windows and occurs in every rust program that I've compiled on Linux, not when compiling, but running it.
